FuncDef:
The peer advertise-large-community command enables a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to a BGP peer.
The undo peer advertise-large-community command cancels the configuration. The peer advertise-large-community command enables a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to a BGP peer. The undo peer advertise-large-community command cancels the configuration. By default, a device does not advertise the Large-Community attribute to its BGP peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Disables the Large-Community attribute from being advertised to a BGP peer.
-

ExtraInfo: To enable a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to its BGP peer, run the peer advertise-large-community command. If the Large-Community attribute is advertised to a peer, all the peer members in the group inherit this configuration. This simplifies the application of route-policies and facilitates route maintenance and management.
